title: Child airlifted to Birmingham hospital after shooting in Auburn
content:
AUBURN, AL (WSFA) -
A child was injured in a shooting Friday night in Auburn, according to the Auburn Police Department.
The shooting happened around 8:45 p.m. Friday in the Orchard Way Mobile Home Park off Lee Road 57, which is also known as Willis Turk Road.
The 11-year-old boy was taken by a private vehicle to Highway 14 near Blackburn Lane. That's where the child was picked up by a medical helicopter and transported to Children's of Alabama hospital in Birmingham.
Auburn Police Chief Paul Register says this is a criminal matter, and they don't think this was an accidental shooting.
Witnesses were being interviewed. No one was in custody Friday night.
Register says the boy is in stable condition and is expected to make a full recovery.
